content.description:
A traverse that starts with the "crux" move. Not the most demanding. Starts a bit thin on the foot side. But it is pretty solid otherwise. The only problem though not huge is that there is a single bolt to rap off of. Two would be more secure.

Facing the rock from Hidden Valley campground, it is on the far left side and obvious when making the turn.
content.protection: Medium size gear and don't forget to protect your follower.

content.description:
First crux comes as you mantle and enter the leftward ramp.  Pro through the ramp is there, but a bit tricky as per JT.  At the left end of the ramp, enter a left arching crack with dark rock (second crux) and finish up a slab up top.

Descend off the back of the climb.
content.protection: Pro to 3" with emphasis on small to medium.  Nuts helpful through the traverse.
content.location: East side of One Potato.  (When facing Cyclops from the nearest parking, it'll be on the left side of One Potato.)
